page.title: 14PEOPLE'S FEARS AT HARDWICK
page.content: Here in an area where it could almost be thought time has stood still, the everyday worries of the inhabitants are very much rooted in the present day. The fear of{redundancy}looms heavily over those employed in businesses and the problem of unemployment generally is a great concern to all. The possibility of a{nuclear war provides for some a nagging irritation and is accompanied by an{abhorrence of {violence}in all its forms. However, because many of the inhabitants are farmers it is the {weather}which causes them the greatest anxiety. This is a particular worry after such a poor summer as this one in 1985. Changing attitudes also worried some, especially the dictatorship of{greed and the{lack of respect}for authority.
